node.title: Genomic testing for Omicron underway after infected South African passengers touch down in Sydney
node.alt: A passenger walks next to a departures sign at Sydney International Airport
node.description: Urgent genomic testing is underway to determine if infectedÂ passengers who arrived in Sydney from South Africa contracted the Omicron COVID-19 variant.
node.content:
["Urgent genomic testing is underway to determine if infected\u00a0passengers who arrived in Sydney from South Africa contracted the Omicron COVID-19 variant.", "Australian states and territories yesterday reinstated border rules in response to the new Omicron strain, which was first identified in southern Africa and has been detected in several countries.", "The World Health Organization (WHO) this week declared Omicron as a \"variant of concern\" due to its hyper-infectiousness and fears it could be resistant to vaccines.", "NSW Health confirmed 14 passengers who arrived in Sydney yesterday\u00a0are from one of the nine southern African countries of South Africa, Lesotho, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Namibia, Eswatini, Malawi, and the Seychelles.", "Testing on arrival identified two of these passengers who arrived on Qatar Airways QR908, Doha to Sydney, around 7pm last night contracted COVID-19.", "The passengers were transported to the Special Health Accommodation (SHA) where they will undergo 14 days of quarantine.", "NSW Health said other passengers on the flight may be considered a close contact and will be contacted to get tested immediately, as well as isolate for two weeks.", "Although fully vaccinated international arrivals were exempt from isolation upon arrival, the rules were yesterday tightened for travellers in nine African countries where the Omicron strain was first found.", "No cases have\u00a0been identified in NSW, but the new strain has been found in Hong Kong, Botswana, Belgium and Israel.", "The federal government joined more than 20 nations in implementing measures to stop the spread of the variant.", "It comes less than a month after NSW completely removed all quarantine requirements for fully vaccinated international arrivals.", "Victoria and the ACT had followed suit, effectively opening the international border to half of the country from the start of November.", "In response to Omicron concerns, however, any international arrivals into Victoria and NSW will now be required to self-isolate for at least 72 hours, regardless of vaccination status.", "\"The emergence of this new variant reinforces the critical importance of all fully vaccinated travellers who return from overseas complying with the NSW Health guidelines,\" NSW Health said in a statement.", "\"There are requirements to be tested and restrictions on attending certain high-risk premises.\"", "", "
What COVID-19 travel insurance doesn't cover you for(Emilia Terzon)
"]
